- DIR LOCAL OWNER

- OPEN N. CHINA (INT. CAOFEDIAN) AUG 30 / SEPT 2

- TRADING CIS RU/S. AFRICA RGE

- PREFER CIS COAL

 

MV. HOPE

Type : Bulk Carrier
Built : 2005 , Japan, IMABARI Shipyard, Japan.

DWT/Draft

Summer SW 53,474 mts @ 12.303 m extreme / tpc 55.30 mt/cm

Winter SW 52,063 mts @ 12.047 m extreme

Tropical SW 54,892 mts @ 12.559 m extreme

LOA/LBP 189.94 m. / 182.00 m Breadth (moulded) 32.26 m. Depth (moulded) – 17.30 m.

GT/RT (International 1969) : 30,002/18,486

Suez Canal : 31,129,20 / 28,617.44

Panama Canal NT : 24,902

 

Speed/Consumption at Sea

BALLAST - Abt 13.5 knots on abt 26.5mts VLSFO including auxiliaries + 0.2mts ULSMGO

LADEN - Abt 13.5 knots on abt 30.5mts VLSFO including auxiliaries + 0.2mts ULSMGO

 

5 holds/5 hatches

Hatch covers: 4 panels per hatch end folding type, double skin - hydraulic cylinder operated.

Hatch opening – 21.12 m. (L) x 17.60 m. (W), ALL HATCHES

 

Holds tank-top dimensions, minimums excluding lower stools, bulkhead corrugations etc (approx only wog)

Hold No. 1 Length 29.0 m, X19,00 m X 19.30 M MIN

29,00 X 30,50 X 19.30 M MAX

Hold Nos 2 , 3, 4 29,00 M X 32,26M X 17,50 M MAX

MIN 29,00 MX 23,90 M 17,50 M Hold

No. 5 MAX 29.80 Mx 32,26 m x17,50 m

Min 29,80m x 19,40m x17,50 m

 

Cargo Gear:

4 units electro/hydraulic deck cranes each 30.5 mtons SWL,

Working radius at swl 30.5mt 26 mtrs , Maximum clear outreach 9.87mtrs.

Cranes capable of use in grab operation When cranes on grab or on skip/bucket duty maximum gross lifting limited to 24mt (ttl weight of grab or skip/bucket and cargo).

 

No more than 1 ship's crane to be worked simultaneously at a hatch. Owners will not supply crane men from Crew.

 

Vessel's cranes designed and class approved to operate within the designated capacities/parameters (for further details

refer to makers' instruction manual) only in a harbour or sheltered waters environment with no significant movement

of the ship due to wave action, nor any relative movement between crane/grab and cargo if loading/discharging

into/from barges, transhipment or similar environmental conditions to be less than Beauport force 2 , sea state 1.-

 

Ambient temperature for cranes operation: -10degrees C to +40degrees C.

 

Grabs: 4 X 12 cbm

Type: “Hook –on “/ “Radio-controlled”, Opening single rope

Maker: Tobu Jukogyo Co.Ltd, Model RSHC-120 /60x3

Volume capacity: 12/6 cbm cargo density 1/1.87 mt/cbm

Grabs suitable only for cargoes with material grain size from min 2mm to max 50mm. When cranes on grab duty

maximum gross lifting limited to 24,00mt (ttl weight of grab and cargo).

When the vessel calls at port or terminal where required mooring ropes in addition and/or of different specification

from what the vessel has onboard to be supplied and/or hired at chrtrs’ cost time

 

Tank capacities:

-abt 1,934,45 mt VLSFO (excl serv/settl tanks), bss 90% full and SG of fuel 0.95

-abt 314 mt ( 388m3) ULSMGO ( exclserv/settl tanks) , bss 90% full and SG of ULSMGO 0.86

Ballast capacity excluding No 3 floodable hold – abt 14,570 cu.m.

FW capacity: abt 408.04 cu m.

Vessel de-ballasting time need about 30 hours. if the loading speed too fast, there will happen the loading suspend,

such suspend should not be deemed as off hire.

Constants : abt 380 mts excl. fresh water / unpumpables

 

Uniform Strengths: (Homogeneous type of cargo loading conditions)

Tanktops local strength:

Hold #1 21.43 mt/sq.m.

Hold #2 18.00 mt/sq.m,

Hold #3 23.50 mt/sq.m,

Hold #4 18.00 mt/sq.m,

Hold #5 21.00 mt/sq.m.

 

Bulk cargoes to have maximum Specific Gravity of 2.11 metric tons per cubic meter.

 

M/Deck 2.50 mt/sq.m (excluding cross-decks)

Hatch Cover 1- 2.08 mt/sq.m.

Hatch Covers 2 to 5 - 1.75 mt/sq.m

 

Other fittings:

Natural ventilation yes

Cement holes per hold: 2 (diameter: 600 mm)

Aussie hold ladder fitted

 

For all steel products and steel coil loading owners to be contacted for approval with regards to vessel's strength,

intake, and final stowage plan. No California (vertical) block stow for Steel Plates/Slabs etc.

All details about, given in good faith and without guarantee

 

Vessel burns ULSMGO when maneuvering, in confined waters and for starting d/gens or low load.

 

Speed and consumption figures basis up to summer draft, even keel (for laden passages) good weather conditions

up to max Beaufort 4, and/or significant wave height up to 1.25mtrs and no adverse influence of currents,

the first 24 hours and last 24 hours of any sea passage being excluded, also excluding periods with reduction of speed, in straits, in tidal affected waters, high risk piracy areas, due to reasons of safety/visibility or on charterers’ orders.

 

For ballast exchange programs and ballast/de ballast floodable hold, the vessel has the liberty of slow steaming or

stopping or being idle if required. Cost of ballast treatment if required and any loss of speed / time to be for

charterers account.

 

The warranted speeds and consumptions are on an average of the performance results of each passage over

the entire Charter period.

 

Any savings in fuel consumption to be set off against any loss of time and vice versa.

 

Consumption in port:

When idle - about 2.5 tonnes VLSFO

When working – about 5.50 tonnes VLSFO (basis 24 hrs working)

 

Fuel Quality

Charterers undertake to supply only fuel and diesel/gasoil complying with current ISO specifications at the time of supply.

VLSFO - 380 Centistoke ISO 8217:2017 (E) RMG 380 with max sulphur 0.50% Ultra Low Sulphur Marine Gas Oil (ULSMGO) with max sulphur 0.10% grade DMA 8217:2017 Min FIA/100 20 ECN (IP541). VLSFO purchased/supplied in different lots must be segregated.

 

All Fuel shall consist of hydrocarbons derived from petroleum sources and shall not contain any anomalous components

(such as Tall Oil and/or Inorganic Acid Substances) and to be of a stable and homogenous nature.

Fuel have to be free of waste lubricants, chemicals and chemical wastes. Cold flow characteristics of the fuel should be such

that paraffin precipitation does not hinder operability of fuel system components. The fuel shall comply with the specifications of ISO 8217 Table 1 or 2 and to Clause 5 and the Revised Annex VI regulation 18.3. During bunkering, bunker suppliers to comply with reg 18 of Marpol Annex VI and the guidelines set out in IMO res Mepc.182(59) guidelines for representative drip samples to be drawn from ship’s manifold.

 

Seller/Supplier warrants that (i) the products being supplied and barges nominated in this Order are not designated in any sanctions list issued by the UN, US or EU and (ii) is not owned or controlled by any person or entity registered in or operating from Iran, or designated in any sanctions issued by the UN, US or EU.

 

Bunker specifications to conform with any local and/or state and/or international regulations prevailing at any areas, ports and/or places vessel calls/sails.

 

Viscosity for LSFO to be over 30 and Bunkering is not allowed in any CIS ports.

 

CUBIC CAPACITIES: Total 68,927.4 CBM grain, 65,526.1 CBM bale

(Note: above bale capacity is calculated basis of 600 x 600 x 600 mm bale cargo)
